description: Singapore’s present unique combination of cultures is a rich and diverse foodscape steeped in history. Our hawker culture listing to the UNESCO List of Intangible Cultural Heritage highlights the importance and value we place in our food heritage. This module opens the doors to rethinking the role food plays in our daily lives, in our culture, in society, and globally. The various topics covered over the course of this module provide opportunities for thinking about the materiality of food (food sustainability and security), the social construction of foodways and food heritages, and how Singapore’s food future should or could progress towards.
title: Feeding the belly of a nation
